title: Tyt Amulet (Knot of Isis)
description:
Reddish- brown jasper amulet in the shape of a girdle tie. The space enclosed by the upper loop has been hollowed out. The other details have been given by incised lines with some slight rounding to the forms. On the rear surface is incised a rectangle containing “Lady of the House, Beknesiyunu”.
Condition: Small chips; otherwise good.

completeness.name: Best
completeness.description: All data has been vetted. Objects generally have quality photos and descriptions.

labels.content: The Egyptians worked with gold and semiprecious stones from earliest times. They mined both types of material in the desert east of the Nile and in present-day Sudan, called “Nubia” in ancient times after the ancient Egyptian word for gold (nub). Clearly, objects made from these high-value materials were available only to the highest ranks of society.

collections.name: Egyptian, Classical, Ancient Near Eastern Art
